The Group Members Former Schools

Denise Martin, demar4981@oslomet.no, 381351

My high school is located in Kristiansand and is called "Kristiansand Katedralskole Gimle", however
we usually called it by its initials: "KKG". It was mainly a sports school, although,
it still offered other academic studies, for example, I graduated from International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme.

Håvard Gullvik, hagul0327@oslomet.no, 383032

My old school, Høyskolen Kristiania, is private university in Oslo.
As a school it mainly focuses on design courses and puts weight on collaboration between courses
I studied, and finished a bachelor in, Game Design.

Aryo Khodadadi, arkho1753@oslomet.no, 383072

My high school was pretty small and the school did not consist of many students.
My school´s name was Nes, and it is in Årnes in Nes kommune.
They only have a phew different programs/paths,
such as general studies, sports, construction and work sites, electro and health and care.
I studied general studies with a focus on stem.

Edvard Uteng, edute2121@oslomet.no, 383034

My high school is very far north in the country. It is called "Senja Videregående Skole, avd Finnfjordborn"
This school has two different sections. The one i was in focuses more on general studies,
and the other one has more practical courses, to become fishermen and farmers.
I studied general studies with chemistry and "R math".

Sander Hoel, sahoe6668@oslomet.no, 383048

I studied at the same high school as Edvard Uteng, namely Senja VGS at Finnfjordbotn. It is located in the middle of Troms,
and has space for around 60-80, if I remember correctly, students, to sleep at an integrated dormitory. This is perfect for
all the international students studying IB, and for students traveling from all over Troms to study there.
I learnt alot from my three years there, and I still have fond memories from the classes of some of the teachers. They were good at what they did.
Other than that we had a quite decent cafeteria, and they sold wheat buns for 8kr, which was always popular.
